schema.title: IGSN
schema.description: IGSN assigned by SESAR

schema.title: Sample Name
schema.description: name validator

schema.title: Sample Type
schema.description: Sample Type

schema.title: Material (SESAR)
schema.description: Material that the sample consists of using SESAR vocabulary.

schema.title: Description
schema.description: Free text to describe features of a sample such as its components, texture, color, shape, etc.
examples: dredge with 50 pieces of basalt and mud

field.stringValue: Day 223 core sample from unheated control plot 1C of a deep soil warming experiment

schema.title: Collection method
schema.description: Method by which a sample was collected

schema.title: Collection method description
schema.description: Additional information about the collection method
examples: Hand sample collected from the top part of a large boulder

field.stringValue: Collected with a multi-stage corer 5 cm in diameter using a 10 kg hand-held slide-hammer

schema.title: Size
schema.description: Size of the registered object, such as the dimension of a specimen, the length of a core, or the weight of a dredge

schema.title: Purpose
schema.description: Purpose of the Sample

schema.title: Release date
schema.description: Date when sample metadata is publicly accessible and searchable. If null, defaults to date of registration (recommended).

schema.title: Latitude
schema.description: Latitude of the location where the sample was collected in WGS 84 coordinate system. ('Start latitude' for linear sampling features such as dredges.) Needs to be entered in decimal degrees. Negative values for South latitudes.

schema.title: Longitude
schema.description: Longitude of the location where the sample was collected in WGS 84 cooridinate system. ('Start longitude' for linear sampling features such as dredges.) Needs to be entered in decimal degrees. Negative values for 'West' longitudes.

schema.title: Elevation
schema.description: Elevation at which a sample was collected. Use negative values for depth below sea level. Minimum elevation if a range is provided for the elevation/depth below sea level.

schema.title: Navigation type
schema.description: Navigation type

schema.title: Primary physiographic feature
schema.description: Type of physical feature that your sample was collected from (see suggested list)

schema.title: Name of physiographic feature
schema.description: Name of the physiographic feature that you entered

schema.title: Location description
schema.description: Free text description of the location

schema.title: Locality
schema.description: Name of the specific place where your sample was collected. This could be the name of a mine, a volcanic field, a vent field, or similar
examples: Craters of the Moon National Park

field.stringValue: Blodgett Forest Research Station, University of California

schema.title: Country
schema.description: Country

schema.title: Field program/cruise
schema.description: Name or identifier of the field program (cruise or expedition), during which the sample was collected.

schema.title: Collector/Chief Scientist name
schema.description: Name of the person who collected the sample. In case of larger field programs, name of chief scientist responsible for sample collection.

schema.title: Collector/Chief Scientist address
schema.description: Institution, address, & email of the collector or chief scientist.
examples: Woods Hole Oceanographic Institution, Woods Hole, MA

field.stringValue: mstorn@lbl.gov, Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory, CA, USA

schema.title: Collection date
schema.description: Date when the sample was collected.

schema.title: Current archive
schema.description: Name of institution, museum, or repository where the sample is currently stored.

field.stringValue: Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory, CA, USA

schema.title: Current Registrant Name
schema.description: Registrant of the sample in SESAR

schema.title: Organization Registrant Name
schema.description: Registrant organization of the sample in SESAR

schema.title: URL
schema.description: URL for Sample
